reviews.review_text:
Had a wonderful stay at The Kingsbury! The hotel offers an amazing city view‚Äîespecially beautiful at night. The staff were attentive and friendly throughout, and the service was top-notch. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

The buffet had a great variety, and the desserts were a highlight. Overall, a great experience and would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Colombo!

I recently visited this restaurant for their dinner buffet and had a fairly pleasant experience overall. The food was definitely the highlight of the evening. There was a wide variety of dishes available, and most of them were flavorful and well-prepared. From the appetizers to the desserts, everything seemed fresh and thoughtfully presented. I especially enjoyed the main course options, which offered a good mix of vegetarian and non-vegetarian items.

The ambience, however, was just average. The lighting and decor were basic, and while the seating was comfortable enough, the overall atmosphere didn‚Äôt feel particularly cozy or special. It felt more functional than inviting.

One downside was how crowded the restaurant was. It was a busy evening, and the place felt a bit cramped. At times, it was difficult to navigate between tables or get quick service due to the number of people. This did impact the overall dining experience slightly, especially when trying to go for refills at the buffet.

Despite that, if you're mainly looking for a good variety of tasty food at a reasonable price, this place delivers. I‚Äôd consider returning on a less busy night to better enjoy the meal and setting.

Our experience at The Kingsbury was truly exceptional. From the moment we arrived, the service was warm and welcoming. The rooms were luxurious, spotless, and beautifully designed, with stunning views. The food was outstanding, offering a wide variety of delicious options. Every detail was handled with care and professionalism. A perfect 5-star stay ‚Äî highly recommended for anyone looking for world-class comfort and elegance.

During our stay, each and every staff member was beyond helpful. All of the breakfast, front office, and honey outdoor restaurant employees were helpful and courteous. During our stay, we had to move from one room to another. We forgot to transfer one of our valuables and the following day the item was returned to the new room. This was very valuable to me. I am very appreciative to whichever employee returned my item.

The Kingsbury Colombo is a beautiful hotel, with an elegant and upscale atmosphere that makes it a lovely place to visit. We stopped by for their high tea, and while the setting was impressive, the overall experience was just okay. The tea itself was fine‚Äîgood, but nothing particularly special in terms of variety or flavor. The high tea platters, while nicely presented, took 45 minutes to arrive, which felt quite long considering the setting and expectations.

Service was just okay. I had to ask multiple times for water refills and for items like milk for the tea, which really should be offered proactively in a high-end hotel. These small details‚Äîlike refilling water without needing to ask‚Äîare what I would have expected at a place like The Kingsbury, but they were missing here.

That said, the ambiance is what makes it worth a visit. The hotel is gorgeous, and the pool area is especially nice. If you‚Äôre visiting, consider the pool day pass for $15 per person for 3 hours‚Äîit‚Äôs a great way to relax. The poolside tavern is a good spot for a drink or snack.

Overall, the high tea is decent but not exceptional. Worth it for the setting, but service could definitely be improved

name: Ranveli Beach Hotel
address: No.56, 09 De Saram Road, Dehiwala-Mount Lavinia

reviews.review_text: Would never recommend to anyone. Rooms are very dirty and washrooms too. Very bad smell. No water in washrooms. These people try their best to charge huge amount of money more than the room cost per day saying we have damaged this and that. Please be very careful before you get the room. I think even the owner doesn't knw this. This place won't last for long providing such a terrible customer service.

Ranveli Beach Resort offers a budget-friendly stay with direct access to a private beach, providing a serene environment for guests. The staff is noted for their friendliness and attentiveness, enhancing the overall experience. However, some aspects of the resort may reflect its status as a budget accommodation, which could affect comfort levels.

The room had a strong, unpleasant smell and was not properly cleaned. The bathroom was in poor condition, with low water pressure, broken fixtures, and inadequate cleanliness. Overall, it was a disappointing experience.

The rooms were very old and poorly maintained.
The wardrobes in the rooms were just wooden box, completely worn out.
Basic amenities like wifi wasn‚Äôt there,
There was no hot water in the geyser in the washroom as they only worked on solar.
No proper room service was also there.
No hygiene level was maintained.
The towels given to use were dried in front of us in the swimming pool area and then was given us to use them.
Very bad experience..
Shouldn‚Äôt book at any cost.

Ranveli beach resort Located less than 500m from mount Lavinia Beach, this hotel features an outdoor swimming pool, garden, and car park .Family convertible rooms are available, and guests have praised its cleanliness and friendly staff.but it‚Äôs important things are wash room are not good,and not clean

This place was chosen for dinner with family members. We ordered several dishes and it took some time to receive them. But all the dishes were prepared in a very good manner and we were able to get very friendly customer service. You can order food and drinks in Indian style or Chinese style as you wish. It is located in a very beautiful environment and has parking facilities. A large number of people can get food and drinks at the same time. The prices are reasonable. You can get beer or arrack at very reasonable prices. There are two swimming pools and one of them is reserved for small children (2.5 feet) . A friendly staff can provide you with food and drinks as you wish and we all managed to have a wonderful experience.

Rooms are outdated and run down. Basic stay for few hours only. Had breakfast before departure and there was no veg options so they made me impromptu sandwich which was sweet gesture but it was very bad tasting and bread was burnt.

We went for a day out and a birthday celebration.

The location was great near the highway entrance. Enjoyed the Birthday and staffs arranged music also.

When talking about food, the buffet was not much appealing. The varieties are not much. And there were no sea food always

By No means it is a 4 star hotel (It should be 2 star). Though it is close to the airport, the hotel is located in a narrow street which makes the surroundings very poor. The rooms are poor quality, unclean and not having enough amentias or complementary products given. The staff service was poor. The only thing that stayed high in all is food - not of Lankan standards but still better if compared with other facilities.

Reached in hotel after 18 hrs of total travel time.

Room was so smelly and in temperature of 41 felt like room air conditioner was not working.

Could not sleep in bed room.

Electrician tried to fix but failed.

Hot water was served in  room.

Had a dayout recently. Very friendly staff. Nicely maintained hotel premises. Location is also attractive. Fairly good buffet with many choices. There are 2 swimming pools and they catch your attention.

The hotel is very hot, the air conditioning in the room barely works, and without the additional fan it would be unbearable. We saw two lizards in the room. The key card for the room didn‚Äôt work, and we waited an hour for someone to bring us a regular key.
The food in the hotel restaurant is nice, but the portions in the √† la carte restaurant are really small.
The pools and the beach are great.

The price of the accommodation is high for the level of service they provide.

We stayed at Camelot Beach Hotel for 2 nights, after switching from another hotel which was terrible.

The best thing about the stay was probably the food. The hotel restaurant serves a wide variety of delicious meals - including dozens of desserts. The staff is incredibly nice and they always ensure that all the containers are full.

The rooms are overall nice, however they could use some cleaning under the beds - it was full of trash.

The hotel has two pools, both well maintained, and the staff is always there available to help you. The only disadvantage are local sellers walking on the beach by the pool‚Äôs border, constantly bothering you, trying to sell something. Ignoring them doesn‚Äôt help at all. I wish the hotel could do something about it as they can bother you for hours.

Keep in mind that there are no sunbeds on the beach.

Overall, I would very much recommend Camelot Beach Hotel - very good service for a fair price.

We recently visited this location for a relaxing day out, and it had the potential to be a wonderful experience. The location itself was beautiful, and the food was great, making it an ideal spot for a laid-back day. However, our experience was unfortunately marred by a few issues with the staff, particularly at the bar.

There was a staff member named Nishantha who, unfortunately, left a negative impression. His manner of speaking to customers was unprofessional, and it felt like he was treating us poorly. We were simply asking for an afternoon snack, but instead of helping, he directed us to different locations and asked us to join a queue for an event hosted by another company. When we followed his instructions, we were then told that we could not get the snack, and were sent back to the bar. This back-and-forth felt confusing and frustrating.

When we tried to explain the situation to Nishantha, his response was dismissive and rude, making us feel as though we were begging for something that should have been a simple request. We were visiting Sri Lanka from the UK, and my sister and her family came all the way from Australia. This visit was meant to be a special memory for us, but the lack of proper training and communication from certain staff members really took away from the experience.

It‚Äôs such a shame, because with the right customer service, this could have been a truly wonderful day. We hope the hotel provides more training to its staff on how to properly communicate and treat guests, especially in a place with such a strong reputation.

Disappointing hotel.

While employees are nice yet somehow they keep thinking that we are not staying in this hotel. Continue asking us if we are staying here and the number of our rooms.

Rooms are not that great and it should be less than 2 stars. They put online old pictures when it was in a better condition.

AC is good but it has a bad smell as they‚Äôre not cleaning the ducts.

Beach although is accessible but no one is swimming in front of the hotel. You have to walk a bit to find an accessible beach front

My family and I had a great time at this haven. It feels like a sanctuary. If you want a glamorous and lavish experience this is not your place, but if you want to relax, refresh and restart then I would recommend lagoon paradise. Tip: wake up at 5am, the views are amazing and the air is so fresh.
I had a lovely stay at lagoon paradise will come back next time when I come to Sri Lanka
Got a really nice spaghetti plate with tuna and seer fish! Was especially made for us. The fish very very fresh.  Tasted delicious üëç

We had a great experience. The staff is very friendly. Nice hospitality. There is Lagoon access a well. Rooms are spacious  and  comfortable. good design to feel nature. Delicious food. There is an undisturbed view of the lagoon. Best for the relaxation.

Hospitality at its best. We stayed here for a day before catching a flight back to U.S. will definitely come back to stay for longer next time. Great place to relax and enjoy the amazing scenery, and food. The chef and the owner are both attentive in asking us what we needed. A hidden gem in Negambo.

We have visit this place 5 times before 2019 . At that times it was run by lovely family called Chamith and his wife, They treat us like their family members. This time we thought still they are in.  But this time management change and they dont have much information about anything. DJ music troubles sleeping and room was not set enough.very bad

Really a good family little hotel. Owners super nice and ready to help you in many situations. Close to the international airport , in the center of Negombo that it's a god place for reach easily other touristic palaces in the west side of the island.
Nice staff. 24/7 reception but call them before. Instant coffee toast and egg. Just clean enough. Decent bed. Good for a night close to the airport
No receipt given for charges. No enough infirmation about their procedures. Be ready to sleep in your own vehicle if you go out at night.
comfortable rooms with reasonable price. No pool/No garden, close to all shopping

We held my father‚Äôs retirement party here and had a great experience. Big thanks to Mr. Theja for his fast responses, flexibility, and friendly support throughout the process. Also, special thanks to Mr. Dias, who supervised the event and was extremely humble and honest in handling everything. The whole staff was very cooperative and truly customer-focused. Really appreciated!

I had my retirement party at Opulent River Face Hotel. They gave me a superb service. Specially Mr.Kasun and banquet supervisor Mr.Dias gave me good support to success my event. Food is very tasty and service staff is also very friendly and gave an excellent service. All of my collegues also satisfied with their service and meals. Highly Recommended.

The venue was perfectly arranged, and every detail was handled with great professionalism and care. From the beautifully set up facilities to the courteous and attentive staff, your efforts significantly contributed to the success of the event and left a lasting impression on all our guests.

I had a great stay at this hotel. The rooms are clean and well-maintained.offering a beautiful view and a relaxing atmosphere. The food is decent, and the service is good. Overall, it's worth the price and a great choice for a stay.
I had my wedding on 1st May 2025. Meals and service are superb. Staff and management are also very friendly and helpful. Ideal place to have any occasion. Highly recommended .

My stay at Colombo Court Hotel & Spa was a truly relaxing and memorable experience. Tucked away in the heart of Colombo, this boutique hotel offers a peaceful escape from the city‚Äôs busy streets. From the moment I walked in, I loved the calm atmosphere, tasteful decor, and warm hospitality.

The rooms were beautifully designed, clean, spacious, and very comfortable, with a perfect blend of modern style and artistic touches. The staff were friendly and attentive, always ready to help with a smile.

One of the highlights was the rooftop bar and pool area. It was the perfect spot to unwind in the evening with a nice drink and a great view. The food was also excellent, fresh, flavorful, and nicely presented, both at breakfast and during dinner.

If you're looking for a quiet, stylish stay in Colombo with a personal touch, I highly recommend Colombo Court Hotel & Spa. It‚Äôs ideal for couples, solo travelers, or anyone who appreciates comfort, art, and good service.

I would say this is the best hotel in Colombo. From the rooms to the service, everything was exceptional. We stayed for 8 to 9 days in November, and the staff was truly amazing. The front manager and their team, along with the food and beverage team and the entire staff, were incredibly humble and accommodating.

I am eagerly looking forward to my next visit to Sri Lanka, and without a doubt, we will be staying at the same hotel. This place truly feels like home. What I love most about this hotel is its unique charm and its close connection to nature. Keep up the great work!

You all are truly amazing ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Wonderful, cozy place in a very nice location with some amazing staff. They are very friendly and accommodating. Especially Ramesh has been assisting us from the time we made the booking until we checkout. Breakfast was nice. Rooms are very spacious.

I recently stayed at Colombo Court Hotel & Spa for two days, and it was a wonderful experience from start to finish. The hotel offers a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and warm hospitality.

The staff was extremely friendly, attentive, and always ready to assist with a smile. The check-in and check-out process was smooth and efficient.

The rooms were spacious, clean, and beautifully designed with modern amenities. The bed was very comfortable, ensuring a restful sleep after a long day of sightseeing.

One of the highlights was the rooftop bar and restaurant‚Äîa perfect place to relax in the evening with a great city view. The food was delicious with a good variety of local and international dishes.

The spa facilities were excellent. I had a relaxing massage that truly helped me unwind. The pool area was well-maintained and provided a calm atmosphere to relax.

I also loved the eco-friendly concept of the hotel, which is beautifully designed with art and greenery all around.

Overall, a fantastic stay! Highly recommend Colombo Court Hotel & Spa for anyone looking for a peaceful and luxurious experience in Colombo. I will definitely return on my next visit.

Absolutely loved our stay. Very spacious and cozy rooms. Bathroom is huge as well wit separate shower and bathtub. All amenities available including a PC! The staff couldnt be more helpful and welcoming. The rooftop restaurant offers a great variety of local and international foods and drinks, all served to perfection with a great city view. We had to leave early to the airport and the staff were kind enough to prepare us a yummy breakfast incuding a sandwich, fruit bowl, juice, pastries and water. Highly recommend choosing this hotel and would definitely stay there again.
Very good location & Attractive Room & Services! I like It üëçüëå

Positives: air conditioning was absolutely fantastic !! It worked well throughout the night and kept us cool. Breakfast is very basic ( slice of toast 1 egg and a little bit of fruit and some coffee)
Negatives: found a cockroach in my bedding and although the bedding was clean and ironed it had some stains on it. The bathroom is very outdated but the loo is western style so no squatting !

Lovely Guest House. Staff are so nice and accommodating.
Rooms are big and very clean with A/C and a beautiful view of the beach.
Perfect location walking distance to lots of restaurants and shops and right on the beach too with a beautiful view of the sunset.

What a charming place with a nice garden with palmtrees, your feet in the sand and the sea at 50 meters! Nice clean rooms and hot water in the bathroom.  But most of all, Milan, his wife and the rest of the staff, all of them doing their best to give you a wonderful stay. It was my wife's birthday and she received cake and flowers as a surprise! We can only but advice this warm home. If we could, we would give a score of 11/10!
Thank you so much, Milan! Wim and Anneke from Belgium
One of the best places to stay by the negombo beach with reasonable charges.

Highly recommended place for everyone come and spend a day out it‚Äôs very relaxing and quiet place with great service with friendly staff. Also there is the best safety place to make a party with family and friends. Very reasonable for the price and they give us high service. You must try their menu and you can customize as your choice. The security is so high. This hotel was the ideal spot for our celebration! The food was absolutely delicious ‚Äî full of flavor, beautifully served, and enjoyed by everyone. From starters to desserts, every dish was a hit. The atmosphere was lively and vibrant, making it a great place to party with friends or family. The staff was super friendly and made sure everything ran smoothly throughout the night. The music, lighting, and spacious setup created the perfect party vibe. Highly recommended for anyone looking for great food and a fun place to celebrate!

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è (5/5)

Superb location in Negombo.  2 minute walk from main street and beach.

Hotel staff welcoming and friendly and nothing too much trouble, ask and they will accommodate.

Rooms are spacious and clean with kitchenette, sitting area,  bedroom and ensuite.  Balcony area with table and chairs. Lovely pool and well maintained gardens.

Owner is lovely and approachable and the hotel is able to arrange transport for trips and to and from the airport.  Although I only used the restaurant facilities once while staying I have eaten here before and food is fresh and varied and caters for every taste.

A wonderful stay thank you.

We stayed for 2 nights, at their suite room next to pool. Room is big and worth for price, but it has to be more clean. Their service was excellent friendly staffs. Quiet place, very close to the beach aide road which has lots of pubs and restaurants.

Not far from the beach. But very poor breakfast, old furniture, dirty floor, dusty‚Ä¶ Maybe long time ago it was a good hotel but now‚Ä¶
Ants making a house inside of living room table‚Ä¶
When I was lying and having a rest at daytime staff was coming and disturbing with some TV problems (I don‚Äôt use it). There is no elevators, only stairs, so not easy to take lugagge down.

Definitely we won‚Äôt come back and won‚Äôt recommend
Not a good place to stay the rooms had bad air conditioning and there were rats near the pool. Just choose a different hotel for your stay.

My partner and I had a lovely time here.

The best thing about the Covanro are the people, the service was the best.

The facilities were good, the pool in particular was fantastic and very clean.

The food was also great, we never were hungry.

And the star surprised us with a fruit bowl and had our towels arranged into a love heart, it was very sweet.

Overall, we would recommend staying here if you need to stay in the area.

Dear All

First of all, I am happy that choosing your hotel for our program was a good decision, because there were no shortcomings until the end of our program. Everything from setting up the hall to serving food and drinks was done very amicably, and we should appreciate that our requests were met promptly from time to time.Here, especially Mr. Tharindu, Ms. Supuni, Ms. Sheron and all the other members who gave us 100% service deserve special thanks and special appreciation. I would like to state that your service, food, cleanliness, customer care, etc. are all 100%.

Kusal Neththasinghe
Operations Manager
Chama Computers PVT LTD

The Covanro, is a great budget friendly hotel option in Veyangoda.

The staff are friendly and attentive, and the property is nice and clean!

The rooms are spacious and fairly clean and comfortable. Some rooms, mainly the bottom floor rooms, do have problems with ants, but the staff will come to quickly resolve it when notified. The AC blows cold which is great! The view from the rooms is okay, a small pond borders a number of the rooms however staying on the balcony isn‚Äôt that easy due to the mosquitoes that come from the pond. The water pressure from the showers could be improved. There is complimentary fruit plates that are served through the time there, great way to try the local fruit options! All organically grown. Very tasty!

The food options are great and there is quite a verity to choose from. Breakfast buffet has a number of different options including both western style and Sri Lankan style.

The pool and bar area is beautiful and is great to relax by. The area is well maintained.

The property itself is situated in one of the more rural towns/cities. It‚Äôs about 30km or so from the airport which could be a 30min or 1hr drive depending on the traffic and time of day. To get to the nearest highway entrance, you must drive to Kadawatha which is about 20mins away.

Excellent Stay ‚Äì Highly Recommended!
I stayed at Hotel Covanro for two days and had a wonderful experience. The food was absolutely delicious with a great variety and taste that exceeded my expectations. The swimming pool was clean, well-maintained, and perfect for a relaxing dip.

What stood out most was the exceptional service. The pool attendant Sugath was incredibly attentive and always available to help with anything we needed. It was clear he took his duties seriously and genuinely cared about guests‚Äô comfort and safety.

Overall, Hotel Covanro offers a peaceful and enjoyable stay with great food and fantastic service. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing getaway.

Let me know if you'd like to add any photos or mention the dates of your stay.

People were nice, service and all
But food was not enough good for tourist,should have more options and atleast a buffet!!

I absolutely loved the architecture and interior of this place. I could live here every single day! Very spacious and carefully decorated. Rooms were clean and beautiful. I only had breakfast here and I was happy with it. I'd love to stay here again ‚ù§Ô∏è

The atmosphere in where we were sitting is one of the most panoramic views I‚Äôve ever seen, and the sounds of the wind chime are very soothing to the ears. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the food was amazing. The sushi was amazing and the chicken gyoza was simply so mouthwatering. The tom yum goong and the seafood rice was heavenly. But, my most favorite food here was the cuttlefish. It almost tasted so fresh and hot, and it was just delicious! I loved this place so much, and if I can, I will definitely go again.

I stayed two nights at this place.the hotel ambiance was amazing. The staff was very friendly. It was really nice when the chef came to the table and recommended some delicious food. Tuan the manager was there all the time to support the staff during the evening time. Keep up the good work I will definitely recommend this place for people who like to sit and work during day time.

This is truly a hidden gem! Tucked away in the heart of the city, it offers a perfect blend of luxury, tranquility, and top-tier hospitality. From the moment you step in, the ambiance exudes elegance and comfort, making it an ideal escape from the hustle and bustle of Colombo.

One of the absolute highlights of  is Zen, their in-house Japanese restaurant. Without a doubt, it‚Äôs the best Japanese restaurant in Colombo the attention to detail, the authenticity of the flavors are unmatched. Zen delivers perfection on every plate.

If you‚Äôre in Colombo, a visit to Zeylan is an absolute must! Whether you‚Äôre staying at the hotel or just dropping by for a meal, you‚Äôre in for an unforgettable experience. Highly recommended!

**Zylan Colombo Hotel Review**
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Zylan Colombo Hotel, and I can confidently say it was a fantastic experience from start to finish!
**Location:**
The hotel is conveniently located in Colombo, making it easy to access popular attractions, shops, and restaurants. The surroundings are vibrant, yet the hotel itself offers a peaceful retreat from the bustling city.
**Accommodations:**
My room was beautifully designed, combining modern amenities with a touch of Sri Lankan charm. The bed was incredibly comfortable, ensuring a good night's sleep after a long day of exploring. I appreciated the attention to detail in cleanliness and decoration, creating a relaxing atmosphere.
**Service:**
The staff at Zylan Colombo were exceptional. They were always friendly, attentive, and eager to help. From the front desk to the restaurant staff, everyone contributed to an enjoyable stay. I felt well taken care of, and any requests I made were promptly addressed.
**Amenities:**
The hotel features a lovely rooftop pool with stunning views of the city‚Äîperfect for winding down after a busy day! The breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of options, catering to both local and international tastes. I particularly enjoyed the fresh fruits and authentic Sri Lankan dishes.
**Overall Experience:**
Zylan Colombo Hotel exceeded my expectations. Whether you're visiting for business or leisure, it provides a perfect blend of comfort, luxury, and hospitality. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Colombo, and I can't wait to return on my next visit to Sri Lanka!
---
Feel free to modify this review based on your personal experiences!

name: Topaz Beach Hotel
address: No 21, Poratota Road 63, 11500 Porutota Road, Negombo

reviews.review_text:
We stayed at the Topaz Beach Hotel with a group of teenagers and had a wonderful experience. The staff were exceptionally friendly, helpful, cheerful, and attentive, which made our stay even more enjoyable.

The rooms were clean, spacious, well-ventilated, and air-conditioned, offering a beautiful view of the pool and the beach ‚Äî a real plus. There‚Äôs also a small outdoor shower near the pool, clean and very pleasant, especially in the warm weather.

Breakfast can be adjusted to your preference (English or traditional), and the value for money is excellent.

We highly recommend this hotel without hesitation!

I must say that for those who care about feeling at home, having someone who will always take care of them, this is the hotel for them. Unfortunately, I was sick and the entire hotel staff was on their feet and they immediately brought me a doctor and nurses to take care of me. Beyond that, the whole atmosphere is homely and pleasant. Excellent location and amazing view
Friendly staff. Pork stew, deviled chicken,  fried rice was good. Hot Butter cuttlefish was not up to the mark.

It was a very pleasant stay. The staff were especially awesome‚ÄîNesan, Chamasa, Krishanti, and the chef and all the people are nice and helpful.

Location near to the beach and beach breeze. I enjoyed it.
Staff are so kind and friendly, food is delicious and rooms needs to be little more develop. I love the nature and beach next to hotel

‚òÖ *Never Again ‚Äì Worst Experience at Best Western, Colombo* ‚òÖ

Our stay at Best Western, Colombo was one of the worst hotel experiences we‚Äôve ever had. I would never, never, never recommend this place to anyone.

To begin with, when we requested a dental kit at the reception, we were told it was chargeable‚Äîa basic amenity that most hotels offer complimentary. Then, without explanation, the kit was sent to the room anyway. Similarly, we had to request tea and coffee supplies multiple times, which should have already been provided in the room.

We arrived in the evening expecting a dinner buffet, as mentioned in our booking and payment. But shockingly, there was no buffet at all. Instead, we were simply told to choose between vegetable biryani or non-veg biryani. Buffet

was denied and we were offered a set menu.That was it‚Äîno starters, no sides, no dessert, nothing. It felt like an afterthought or leftovers rather than a properly planned meal. What kind of 4-star hotel does this?

The room itself was average, but several basic issues made the stay even worse:

The washroom door lock didn‚Äôt work, causing significant discomfort.

There was no fridge in the room, and when we informed them we had items like cold drinks and yoghurt that needed refrigeration, we were told, "You can keep your items in our fridge." Only after repeated insistence did they say a fridge would be moved to our room‚Äîbut that would only happen the next morning!

Every time we raised a concern, all we heard was "sorry"‚Äîbut only by mouth, not by heart. If those apologies had come from genuine concern, the same problems wouldn't have kept repeating.

The service was poor, the staff indifferent, and the hospitality non-existent. No courtesy, no ownership, no sense of professional responsibility.

For a hotel carrying the Best Western brand name, this place is a complete embarrassment. *It borders on false advertising and should be seriously investigated for misrepresentation*.

*Never again. Never recommend. Avoid at all costs*.

The following pictures show the complete breakfast. And many things but stale and dry.
Nice rooms, clean and neatly made. Convenient location to airport and city. Friendly staff. Food was a let down. Limited spread, some disused not very tasty, breakfast was stone cold

The breakfast buffet price was reasonable for the spread they offered and very friendly staff from the entrance to the restaurant. Even the chef was serious about the quality and asked for feedback including the manager in charge.food is tasty and you can enjoy with your family with prior reservations.

Had a great stay! The hotel was clean and comfortable, but what really stood out was the service. Cassandra and Devmini were super helpful and kind‚Äîespecially when our luggage got delayed. Would definitely come back!

Mr Shaan
Thank you for being so committed. I was particularly impressed with how smoothly everything was organized by you and your team members. Once again, thank you for providing your valuable ideas by answering the phone calls at anytime. I will recommend your hotel to anyone without hesitation. Good luck!

I arrived on 09/07/2025. I am a local tourist and the management of this resort is very good. But we stayed there for one day..The person in charge of the maintenance of the swimming pool here has no manners and does not know how to speak and behave in a way that is important to him. He is a person who does not fit in that place. But all the other officials and staff provided us with very good service. We will come back to this Ambalama resort. I do not expect such inconvenience again.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Ambalama Leisure Lodge, and it was an unforgettable experience. The hotel is surrounded by lush greenery, creating a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere perfect for anyone looking to escape the hustle and bustle of daily life.

Used to stay at cottage named ‚Äúkubalge‚Äùand it was clean, spacious, and well-maintained, offering a comfortable stay with all the necessary amenities. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, always making sure that we had everything we needed. Their warm hospitality truly made us feel great.

The food was another highlight of our stay. The restaurant & bar served delicious Sri Lankan cuisine, and every meal was fresh and flavorful. Their mixological artistry is truly commendable,we thoroughly enjoyed their cocktails.

The hotel also has a beautiful swimming pool, which was perfect for unwinding after a long day. Additionally, its location near Leisure World Water Park made it easy to enjoy some fun activities nearby.

Overall, Ambalama Leisure Lodge is a best place for those seeking a peaceful retreat with great service, delicious food, and beautiful surroundings. I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the area!

It was more than I expected.
The food and staff services were excellent, and it's a wonderful place to visit for the scenic views. The rooms were uniquely named instead of being numbered‚Äîsuch as ‚ÄúThe House of the Traditional Doctor‚Äù and ‚ÄúPorter‚Äôs Workplace‚Äù‚Äîwhich added a charming touch to the experience.
And don‚Äôt miss the chance to have fun with him‚Äîthe friendly dog who made our stay even more delightful

The place was booked for a friends gathering. Which we were left disappointed after reaching to the place. We were allocated in the Guru Gedara cottage. There were no lights in the walking path. Started to smell badly the more you get closer to the cottage. The bed linen was dirty and filthy, and cocroaches were found on the floor. Mouldy walls and non AC rooms for the price quoted left us no choice at late night. We requested a refund as we had no choice but to find another accommodation at night. The reception person had no idea of doing where he had to call his manager as he was rejecting to give the refund. Shantha, who appeared to be the manager, had no sense of customer service where he started speaking like we did them wrong.  The exact words were, "we can't do anything now as we lost other business also because of you, so can not refund."
At last, we had to go on an argument to get our money back as he tried to hold our deposit forcefully. Then Shantha revealed himself as the Housekeeping manager where he could not take any decisions on the refund. We were speechless that after all these conversations, he appeared not the relevant manager to handle the situation. At last, we got our refund and asked me to sign on a blank paper as they could not find the refund reciepts. Which ended us up more frustrated. üò°
This is the worst way to do your business, and I would not recommend anyone to go to this place. Our friends reunion was ruined because of them. Around 2200hrs we were at road still looking for places to stay ......... üòì

We recently had a family gathering of 45 people at Ambalama Leisure Lounge, and it was a wonderful experience. The food was excellent, and the staff made every effort to accommodate our requests.

The kids had a fantastic time in the well-maintained pool, and the whole setup of the facility is perfect for family gatherings. The place is clean and conveniently located, with ample parking available.

I highly recommend Ambalama Leisure Lounge for family get-togethers!

Few days ago  i went to that hotel with my 3friends and get 2 doublerooms.how ever rooms not cleaned well and main problem is bathroom water pressure is very low.after few minuts water completely stops coming.finely informed to the hotel worker and water came back after 15 minuts .but that not enough for have a bath.chargers also high and we cant recomond this hotel for anyone

Good location ...
But nothing to good working process üò¢
Reasonable priced and suitable for local low ranked business

Came to Sri Lanka with my family. The hotel was ongoing renovations but we still had a really good time and the service was great! The hotel fit our budget and was close to the airport so the journey from the airport to the hotel was convenient. There was pool access so my kids really enjoyed the pool services and the staff was really nice and gave us good recommendations for Sri lankan food! Was a little spicy but amazing and they even offered to go and get the food for us! Would definitely recommend!!

My stay at Mizuki Plaza Hotel in Kandana was wonderful. Despite ongoing renovations, the place was comfy and clean. The staff was friendly, and the atmosphere was relaxed. Perfect for a peaceful getaway.

Really good place. Clean and comfortable setting.
We only visited the short eats cafe. Quality of the food items was really good. Everything seemed freshly made. The prawn rotti had about 2 or 3 small prawns per bite and an adequate and balanced amount of curry. Superb work.

The food tasted great, and it was worth the money. The portion sizes were good, and I felt satisfied with the meal. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. Overall, I would rate it 4/5 and would recommend it to others!
Five of us had lunch here and the food was tasty and service was excellent. This is our second visit and we will be going there again. Highly recommended.

visited Choy‚Äôs Lagoon Front for breakfast and was quite disappointed with the experience. The service was below expectations, with staff displaying unprofessional and discourteous behavior. There appeared to be no proper system for attending to customers based on arrival, which led to confusion and delays. Unfortunately, I will not be recommending this establishment based on this experience.
Today I ordered fried rice through PickMe Foods and was somewhat disappointed with the portion size. I felt that the value for the price was not quite what I had hoped for.

This was a great place to stay! The rooms were a bit small, no bells and whistles but really a satisfying place to stay, and great value for what you pay! They gave us a welcome drink of juice, they had water bottles and coffee packs in the rooms. The towels and sheets smell wonderful, nice hot water ac works great. Beds were very comfortable. We came for business, so what we needed was a good night sleep and we got that. Only thing was there is only a top sheet, if the ac is too cold, there‚Äôs no blanket. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is limited parking. Someone was parked in the only spot in front of the hotel, so they had what looked like a house across the street they had us park there. They have morning breakfast optional, we just went to Java down the road. There‚Äôs a Java and barista nearby. Really a great place to stay if you need a budget friendly, clean and comfortable place in Colombo!

This wasn‚Äôt a 5-star hotel, but honestly, it felt just perfect! From the moment I arrived, I felt completely at home. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, and the comfort level was beyond expectations. Everything about the place made it easy to relax‚Äîit truly felt like a home away from home.

The location was another huge plus! Centrally situated, it was super convenient to get around Colombo, whether for sightseeing, dining, or just enjoying the city vibe.

If you're looking for a cozy, well-located, and genuinely comfortable place to stay in Colombo, this is it. Absolutely loved it and would come back in a heartbreak!

The man him self Ravin best customer service also other staff and the chef so friendly and kind very good place I am from Canada I stop by for 3 days definitely I will recommend at other people. Also our will come next time. Thank you.

Staff not helping not understand English
Food charge so much high but quantity little bit and quality also bad üòî wasted of money. Near by no restaurant nothing as per that have to food from hotel and hotel take that advantage and take high price but bad quality.

Great little hotel, great value and amazing service.
Thank you to all the staff , especially Ravin, 1st class service.

Our recent stay at Blue Elephant Hotel was unfortunately one of the most disappointing experiences we‚Äôve had. We opted for the full board package (FB), expecting a comfortable and enjoyable stay, but it turned out to be a poor value for the money spent.

To begin with, the hotel offers a fixed menu with very limited variety ‚Äì only three meal options were available. What made it worse was that both lunch and dinner menus were nearly identical, leaving no room for culinary excitement. The food lacked flavor and quality, and overall did not justify the price charged.

The room we stayed in was also underwhelming. It lacked the comfort and amenities one would expect at this price point. Adding to the disappointment, the hotel is located in a congested area, surrounded by residential houses, which took away from the sense of privacy and relaxation we were hoping for. There‚Äôs also very limited space within the property, making it feel more like a guest house than a hotel.

Customer service was another major letdown. There was no proper communication system available to contact the reception from the room ‚Äì something that should be a basic feature in any hotel. The staff seemed untrained and were not particularly attentive or welcoming, which further affected our overall impression.

Given all of the above, we wouldn‚Äôt recommend Blue Elephant Hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing and worthwhile stay. There are certainly better options available that offer far greater value, better service, and a more satisfying experience overall.

It's a nice cozy hotel to stay. Clean, quiet, authentic. Air conditioning works well. Thick curtains and comfortable bed allow you to sleep well.
The pool is clean and deep enough.
There are shops and cafes nearby, just 5-15 mins to walk.
I've enjoyed staying here ‚ù£Ô∏è

Staff was very friendly. Calm place with an aesthetic theme. Rooms are very nice and clean. Compared to the other places nearby, worth for the price. They have the Tusk restaurant with the hotel. So you can order food to the room or dine-in.

We spent a really good time at the hotel. There is only a 10min walk to the beach. Good restaurants and pubs are also in walking distance, but beware of getting catcalled by the locals. (Especially if you are a Sri Lankan girl. I really hope that they do not catcall the foreigners and make them uncomfortable üòÖ)
The rooms were spacious, the staff was friendly and the architecture was also nice. Parking is available.

Lovely peaceful place with an amazing pool beautifully decorated. Very good Sri Lankan food staff friendly professional and attentive. We felt amazing here and highly recommend this place to stay you won't regret it!

A hotel that can really be recommended. I had my wedding here. The service is top notch. I talked to the chef and everything was done well. The taste of the food is top notch. The full board room they provided is also great. The food they provided is also great. I can really recommend it highly.

Beware of Unprofessional Management ‚Äì Would Not Recommend

We had a terrible experience at this hotel, mainly due to the extremely unprofessional behavior of the current manager. We booked a 2-night stay (room only) and confirmed the price twice over the phone ‚Äî Rs. 14,000 in both calls. The manager himself gave us this rate.

We informed them ahead of time that we would be checking in late (around 10:30 PM) due to a dinner event. The manager agreed without any issue. But when we arrived, a staff member asked us to pay Rs. 19,700 ‚Äî a massive and unexplained increase.

When we questioned the difference, the staff member checked with the manager (who was outside) and returned saying the higher price was due to check-in hours being 9 AM‚Äì5 PM. This made no sense, as we never booked a day-use package. We asked to speak directly to the manager, but he refused to come inside and just told the staff: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the price.‚Äù

Eventually, we went outside to speak to him ourselves, and he casually admitted that he quoted Rs. 14,000 ‚Äî but then said ‚Äúnow this is the price, if you can‚Äôt pay‚Ä¶‚Äù and told staff to ‚Äúcall another customer and give the room.‚Äù This was shocking.

The junior staff were kind and apologized, asking us to stay just for one night, but we couldn‚Äôt accept the manager‚Äôs arrogant and unethical behavior. Even though it was late, we found a much better place nearby ‚Äî something he clearly didn‚Äôt expect us to manage.

This feels like a bait-and-switch tactic. It also seems some of the positive reviews may not be genuine, as even staff were openly speaking about how difficult it is to work with this manager. After sharing our experience with friends, a few of them reported similar or even worse situations involving him.

If you expect professional hospitality, this is not the place. I hope the top management seriously looks into the conduct of this manager before more customers are driven
Yesterday wedding function was verry nice. All Staffs are doing good job. Thanks kamaro holiday resort
Exceptional service and delicious food. The staff and  especially Mr.Mohan are attentive and friendly.Highly recommended for a wonderful gathering.

We had an amazing experience at the resort. We were provided with a very friendly and top notch service with great food. The location is convenient with a stunning view of the Bolgoda Lake. Will revisit again soon!
